newsitem.title: USA: IMC Global cutting back on potash output.
newsitem.headline: IMC Global cutting back on potash output.

text.p: IMC Global Inc said Wednesday it is temporarily reducing output at three of its potash mines in Saskatchewan by slightly extending Christmas shutdown schedules.

"While our overall inventories are in excellent shape, these measured cutbacks will further ensure that we enter the new year in a strong position that will support our marketing efforts," John Huber, president of IMC Kalium, the potash business unit, said in a statement. "We are committed to the ongoing supply-side management of our operations."
Huber said that the extended production cutbacks will reduce IMC Kalium's potash output by about 200,000 tons, nearly double the normal tonnage reduction during this seasonal shutdown.

Mines affected by the cutback are the Esterhazy, K-1 mine, which was shut down December 16 and will remain closed until January 4; the K-2 mine, which will be shut from December 20 until January 2, and Central Canada Potash in Colonsay, which will be down from December 23 until January 2.
IMC is one of the world's leading producers and marketers of phosphate and potash crop nutrients and animal feed ingredients.
